newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Ecuador needs investment to avoid power rationing.
newsitem.headline: Ecuador needs investment to avoid power rationing.

text.p: Ecuador urgently needs private investment in its electricity sector to avoid further energy rationing, Energy and Mines Minister Alfredo Adum said.
Adum told local television on Thursday that the experience of countries like Chile and Argentina has shown that energy generation was handled more efficiently by private industry.
He said that it was vital Congress pass a new electricity bill currently under debate after being vetoed by the previous government of Sixto Duran Ballen.
"That new law must pass because it is the only way of attracting foreign investment in building new hydroelectric plants," Adum said.
Ecuador, which suffered up to eight hours a day of electricity rationing in 1995, generates 70 percent of the power available to its 11.4 million inhabitants at the Paute hydroelectric dam.
But Electroquil power firm warned that if the level of Paute's dam waters keeps falling at the present rate, more rationing will be necessary in 10 to 15 days.
President Abdala Bucaram said that power shortages restrict economic growth and said that the country needs $5 billion invested in generation.
